I'm seeing this problem, and it's pretty nasty, because it has the ability to delete files.

I see #2540 has been closed - is a fix still on its way?
Unfortunately this is a showstopper for me. I need to use symlinks, and I need to be able to exchange them with directories. I can't have syncthing deleting a load of my work when I do.
Workaround in the meantime is to allow a rescan to happen after removing one and before creating the other.

issue.title: lib/model: Mark files below newly created symlinks as deleted (fixes #2571)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

The scenario is well described in #2571, in short: If a dir is replaced by a symlink, the files within the dir aren't marked as deleted in the database if they exist at the location the new symlink points to. The other device will therefore fail to remove the directory because it isn't empty.  
The issue further describes that when you manually delete the directory, contents from the symlink target gets deleted: This isn't the case even previous to this PR, as we check that we don't descend into symlinks.

### Testing

New unit test for this scenario.

issue.title: lib/model, lib/scanner: More precise deletion detection (fixes #2571, fixes #4573)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

Fixes #2571 and #4573 by extending the file info returned from a scan by a "ReplacedDir" parameter, which signifies that the old file info in the db was a directory (and now is a file/symlink). This information is used to detect deleted children, for which "IsNotExist" returns false.  
In addition this makes sure that these deleted children are updated in the db before their parent is replaced, thus preventing intermediate pull (dir not empty) failures when the entire update exceeds the batch size.  
Compared to #4568 (which is obsolete if going forward with the approach of this PR) this uses information from scanning instead of doing more lstat calls.

### Testing

Two unit tests specific to the fixed issues and `TestInternalScan`. The last one is there because all tests passed with an earlier version of this PR, while it was severely broken - this test would have failed.

body:
How do I recover from this?

I have a folder which was replaced with a symlink on my laptop (`Git/github/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/metrics` -> `../../staging/src/k8s.io/metrics`), on my server running Syncthing I got the following error:
```
[ZPRDE] INFO: Puller (folder kristian, file "Git/github/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/metrics"): symlink remove: remove /home/backup/st/Git/github/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/metrics: directory not empty
```
So I deleted `/home/backup/st/Git/github/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/metrics` on the server and did a rescan on both the server and my laptop, and the server successfully created the symlink, but it still tries pulling some files from the directory (ex: `Git/github/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/metrics/pkg/apis/custom_metrics/BUILD`), which never succeeds. How can I delete this files from Syncthing database?

Syncthing v0.14.43

@klausenbusk What should work for sure is if you delete both the directory and the symlink on both devices, then get them in sync and after that recreate the symlink. I do not understand why deleting on the server isn't enough, but as #4584 already fixes the underlying problem, it I am not particularly interested in finding out.

> @klausenbusk What should work for sure is if you delete both the directory and the symlink on both devices, then get them in sync and after that recreate the symlink.

Thanks, I ended up renaming the symlink on my laptop, rescan on both devices and rename it back, and now everything is working again. :)
